meta.content: Kamiah School District is located in the panhandle of Idaho. We are proud to be a part of the Kamiah Community!

div.p: "Enter: Ready to Learn; Exit: Prepared for the Future" Kamiah Elementary School is nestled in the hills of the Clearwater Valley. We provide a safe environment where students and staff are treated with fairness, respect and dignity. Students are challenged...

We Respect Our Past As We Create Our Future Kamiah High School strives to prepare young adults to be productive members of society. Our dedicated faculty and staff provide a solid academic program, dual-credit courses, seasonal athletics, student service and leadership...

article.class: post-42140 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: Avista Gifts Five Laptops to Kamiah Schools for Student Use

div.p: Recently we were awarded five laptops for student use from Avista Utilities. The Idaho Business For Education laptop initiative provides laptops for Idaho schools to distribute to students who do not have adequate resources for online learning at home. If Read More …

article.class: post-42041 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: Idaho State Board of Education Directs Soft Closure of Schools Through the End of the Calendar Year

div.p: In accordance with the Idaho State Board of Education directive, Kamiah Public Schools will continue to operate in “Soft Closure” mode for the remainder of the 2019-2020 School District calendar year. Staff will continue to provide on-line and paper-and-pencil educational Read More …

article.class: post-41910 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: Kamiah “Soft-Close” Continues – Food Service Delivers M-Th

div.p: Press Release: 3/26/20 Following directives from Governor Little and the State Board of Education, Kamiah School District will continue to operate with the soft closure until April 20, 2020. Teachers will continue to provide learning packets and/or on-line lessons through Read More …

article.class: post-41868 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: Homework and Meals Delivered Monday 23 March

div.p: Students: Homework packets will be able to be picked up at the Multi-Purpose Room from 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. on Monday, March 23rd. For students on bus routes, they will be dropped off with the lunches on Monday. Staff Read More …

article.class: post-41836 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: School Cancelled For Kamiah Students Through 3 April 2020

div.p: School Board members voted to close Kamiah schools until after Spring Break due to concerns about the COVID-19 virus. We plan to resume school on 6 April 2020. We recognize that this is a hardship for families but believe it Read More …

article.class: post-41831 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: Idaho High School Activities Association Suspends Activities

div.p: The IHSAA has informed all member schools that sanctioned sports and activities for all of its member schools will be suspended effective Tuesday 17 March through 5 April 2020. During this time member schools are not to compete in games Read More …

article.class: post-41826 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

h2.a: Kub STEM Students Take the Gold

div.p: Teacher Janna Privette reports Science Research students Mya Barger (Left) and Cecily Puckett (Right) earned the top honors at the Idaho STEM science fair in Coeur D’Alene. The fair, presented by the Idaho STEM Action Center, featured 85 projects by Read More …

article.class: post-41818 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

div.p: In response to the national concern for the spread of the COVID-19 virus, the Kamiah School District will continue to monitor and be alert to the need for swift action to protect its students and community. The District is relying Read More …

article.class: post-41799 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

div.p: A significant source of funding for student instruction is a local property tax called the Supplemental Levy. On Tuesday, 10 March, the ballot question asked district residents to approve funding for our schools. It was a tight race, but in Read More …

article.class: post-41769 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-education

div.p: The Kamiah High School boys basketball season has come to a close after taking a trip to State. A loss to Ambrose took them to a loser-out round and the boys were able to beat Riverstone 49-46 with the help Read More …
